result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher W Covington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment to be entered against the defendant.
*Provide a specimen for DNA testing.

*Obtain GED or HSED.
*Seek and maintain employment - can be part time.
*Cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

*No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
*Do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher W Covington

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($1,000 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (51 pages) commencing 08-04-2015 received and filed. CH

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 6:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 42 months with 32 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 24 months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; 3) obtain GED or HSED; 4) pay  mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 5) seek and maintain employment - can be part-time; 6) SERVE 45 DAYS at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Christopher W Covington in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Christopher W Covington in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 6 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 6 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for ENHANCED Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   Court ordered absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Christopher W Covington not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Marissa Santiago.
Case scheduled for return on warrant.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  Court sets bail.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/4/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 44.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant case was in warrant status when he appeared in court.  Defendant taken into custody.  Clerk left message for attorney Stewart to call the court to set up return on warrant date.  Attorney Stewart contacted the court.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 7/9/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Stewart informed the court that she has left three messages with the defendant's mom, and has not been able to get in contact with the defendant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court lifts stay on previously ordered a Bench Warrant.  Court vacates trial date for 7/15/2015.  aw

Defendant Christopher W Covington in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for motion hearing.  NO motion was filed.  Defendant was here earlier and then left.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until tomorrow, 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court reminds defendant to have no contact with Kentrell H.

Defendant Christopher W Covington in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel wants to file a motion.  Motion ordered to be filed by 4/15/2015.  State to respond by 4/24/2015.  Case adjourned for motion hearing and final pretrial on 6/29/2015 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 7/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw

Defendant Christopher W Covington in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel wants to see if a DPA can be offered in this case.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/1/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher W Covington in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CO-DEF:  KENTRELL D. HUGHLETT.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher W Covington in court with attorney Alexis B Luster.  Defendant Christopher W Covington in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
